title: Georges Seurat Boxed Note Cards
description:
Notecards developed from Georges Seurat’s A Sunday on La Grande Jatte — 1884, 1884/86; Oil Sketch for “A Sunday on La Grande Jatte — 1884”, 1884; Seated Woman with a Parasol (study for La Grande Jatte), 1884/85; Trees (study for La Grande Jatte),1884 from The Art Institute of Chicago’s collection. 

Seurat painted A Sunday on La Grande Jatte—1884 using pointillism, a highly systematic and scientific technique based on the hypothesis that closely positioned points of pure color mix together in the viewer’s eye. This selection of cards includes the painting and support sketches from the collection. 

The cards are made from a sustainable FSC certified mix paper and vegetable-based inks.

  • Card dimensions: 5 x 7 in.
  • Box dimensions: 5.625 x 7.625 x 1.375 in.
  • 20 cards and envelopes, 5 cards each of 4 images.
